intro: Draba valida, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale purple, and its basal rosette of hairy, narrow leaves. Draba valida thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and tundra environments. It plays an important role in pollination and is a hardy plant adapted to cold climates.
